f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872 (02:07): Hi, the W3C Validator @ validator.w3.org gives me an error stating <meta name="copyright" isn't registered, redirecting me to add it @ http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/MetaExtensions

b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:08): Hello everyone... i am trying to get some guidance on what tools to use for rendering vector graphics to an HTML canvas element... is this the right place to be asking?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:11): f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872: I suggest following the instructions.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:12): b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00: I just use SVG when I need vector graphics.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:12): But otherwise I hear paper.js is pretty cool?
f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872 (02:12): the WHATWG wiki redirected me to here :-p
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:12): Oh, so you need an account created.

b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:13): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I have an engine that I would like to use that is based on the html canvas element... i want to include some extreme zooming gameplay and so I need to either use LOD or vector graphics to provide for that level of zoom
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:13): f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872: /msg me your e-mail address and i'll create one
b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:13): Is there some way to get the performance benefits of a sprite, while still enabling the zoom-ability of vector graphics?
f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872 (02:13): I'm not sure, if the issue is simply that that attribute is not listed, then yes, is that where the W3C validator is reading from?
b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:14): some way to "draw" from a vector graphic at run time for multiple levels of detail?
f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872 (02:14): http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fnikki.dyndns.info%2Ftemp%2Ftemplate.htm&charset=%28detect+automatically%29&doctype=Inline&group=0
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:14): b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00: Drawing from SVG works in some browsers, though it also taints the canvas in some of them.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:14): b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00: Several canvas libraries support js-backed vector graphic syntaxes.
b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:15): js-backed vector graphics syntaxes.. what do you mean exactly?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:16): b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00: Check out, for example, paper.js.  Grab one of their examples and hit the "Source" button in the upper-right corner.
b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:17): i'm looking at it right now... does it draw the whole thing every frame or only upon the shape changing?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:17): Other libraries often do something similar - you create some objects and maybe compose them in a scene, and the library handles drawing.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:17): Never used one of them.  Just pointing out options.
b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:17): right... what i'm trying to avoid is having the CPU draw the entire shape on every frame
b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:17): massive resource cost

b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:18): instead i would like to use vector processing to composite the shape on the first frame, and then load it as if it were a "sprite" or bitmap image from then on
b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:18): basically like a single render pass into a bitmap image
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:18): If you can draw it into a separate canvas, you can then draw that canvas into your main one.
f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872 (02:19): Is the issue with the validator or simply it not being listed on the wiki?
f72f3d2b5a079729a2fea5ac3046e872 (02:22): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e how do I message you?

b5053f1b1c9459b9e3c1064aff45cb00 (02:23): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: do you know a forum where I could post a more elaborate example of what i'm saying and perhaps get some additional feedback?
